Replies.Reply: Grey clouds of an early morning sky.
Once upon a time, in a far off kingdom, there lay a small village at the edge of the woods...
I WISH WE HAD A CHILD.
The poor girl's parents had died--
And now she lived with her stepmother...
...who had two daughters of her own.
All three were beautiful of face, but vile and black of heart.
Well, she was at her wit's end--
And then there was a hungry little girl who always wore a red cape...
I don't suppose you're planning on buying any of these?
And you might save some of those sweets for Granny.
It's the Witch from next door!
Then what is it you wish?
How could you do that to me?
It was my father's. You heard what she said. This is all his fault.
I want nothing to do with him!
We? Wait a minute! You're not coming.
No. I can do this on my own.
Now tell me. What am I to return with?
THERE'S SOMETHING IN THE GLADE THERE.
Deep within the woods, Cinderella had planted a branch at the grave of her mother. And she visited there so often, and wept so much, that her tears watered it until it had become a magnificent tree.
On her path to Granny's, the little girl suddenly found herself in a very unusual part of the wood.
How am I supposed to get it?
I can't just take a cloak from a little girl. Why don't you take it!
Have you saved some of those sweets for Granny?
So I see! Now tell me...where did you get that beautiful cape?
Is that right? I would love a red cape like that.
May I take a look at it?
I'm sorry. I just wanted to make sure that you really loved this cape. Now off you go to Granny's -- and be careful that no wolf comes your way.
This is hopeless. I'll never get that red cape or find a golden cow and a yellow slipper -- or was it a golden slipper and a yellow cow?
You shouldn't be here. It's not safe in these woods!
No! THE SPELL IS ON MY HOUSE--
What might you be doing with a cow in the middle of the forest?
And what are you planning to do there?
Where are we to get five pounds?
Take the cow and go home!
Magic beans! We've no reason to believe they're magic! Are we going to dispel this curse through deceit?
I'm just not sure I'm cut out to be a father.
All right. You take the cow and go home. I'll find the rest of the things. On my own.
The old enchantress had given the name Rapunzel to the child she had hidden away and locked in a a doorless tower.
As the little girl approached her Granny's oak tree, she was surprised to see the door standing open.
And with a single bound, the wolf had devoured the little girl. Well, it was a full day of eating for both.
I can't believe I just did that.
You need to be more careful, young lady.
turned and she had slipped away.
How would you come by five gold pieces?!
Milky-White is back home with my wife.
Wait a minute! I'm not sure I want to sell.
No, no, no! It's not that--
Yes. I've got the cape. Only two items left.
Two. We've the cape and the cow.
What have you done with the cow?!
We were just going to do that. Here.
Go back to the village. I will make things right. And then we can just go about our life. No more witches or dim-
As the Baker's Wife bolted from the tower, the second night of the festival was thrown into chaos when Cinderella once again ran from the Prince.
Please, if you would be so kind, may I compare this ear of corn with your hair?
I thought you were returning home!
Yes. I've the cow. We've two of the four.
We've one entire day left. Surely we can locate the slipper by then.
Well...perhaps it will take the two of us to have this child.
No, no, no - it's not how it sounds!
When dawn broke, the Baker and his Wife had but one day left to reverse the Witch's curse. As for Rapunzel's Prince, he returned yet again to the forbidden tower.
Jack took the little girl's dare and before he knew it, found himself fleeing from a Giant.
We've only one day left! I don't know where to start.
Right, where do I buy a cow?
What are you going to do?
Yes. The golden slipper, that's what I meant. How are you going to get it?
You think you could get one?
The entire kingdom shook when the beanstalk came crashing down, killing the Giant...
...as for Cinderella, she fled from the Prince... again.
And in her haste, the Baker's Wife took no notice of a second beanstalk climbing skyward.
As the Prince anxiously waited, the Stepmother took matters -- and Florinda's foot -- into her own hands.
Minus one toe, Florinda mounted the Prince's horse, unaware of the blood dripping from the slipper.
Minus a heel, Lucinda did her best to swallow the pain.
As punishment for their cruelty, Cinderella's birds swooped down upon the Stepsisters... and blinded them.
As for Rapunzel, the Witch had banished her to a swamp in the darkest depths of the forest.
Come on! We don't have any time...
And the cape as red as blood.
We had a cow as white as milk.
And we thought you'd prefer a live cow.
She's going to bring Milky-White back to life.
She's a witch! She can do anything!
And four, I compared the hair with this ear of corn.
And it came to pass, all that seemed wrong was now right. The Witch succeeded in reversing her mother's curse. Cinderella finally stopped running from her Prince.
Jack was reunited with his beloved cow and his mother could now dress in the best a golden egg could buy.
And the Baker and his Wife were proud parents of a strapping baby boy.
And so with the kingdom filled with joy, those who deserved to were destined to live happily ever...
But as they made their way back into the woods, their familiar paths were nowhere to be found and their lives were about to take an unexpected turn.
Hello, little one. Are you alright?
We can help you find Granny's without the path.
Why does he always cry when I hold him?
He doesn't want me. He wants his mother!
I'll take care of him -- when he's older...
It's the Steward and the royal family.
What brings you into the woods?
What is the Royal family going to do?
Listen everyone. If we're going to get through this we have to stick together.
We're never going to find him.
No. You can't be on your own.
You would leave our son with her?
But what if the Giant comes back...
Wait! Take this. It might be cold.
Four eighty two... four eighty three...
Excuse me, ma'am. Have you seen a boy...
I'm sorry, may I be of some service?
Hah, the Prince? No doubt he's off somewhere seducing some young maiden.
You look just like the Princess -- but dirty. Oh no, you are the Princess!
I'm sorry. I didn't recognize you.
If you'd like you can come with me.
She should be back by now.
No, I must go and look for her--
This is my fault. I let her wander off alone. I should have made her stay with me.
Yes! He's the one to blame! It's because of you there's a giant in our midst and my wife is dead!
It doesn't matter whether we're together or apart.
You don't understand. My wife was the one who helped. I depended on her for everything.
He'll be happier in the arms of a Princess...
I don't want to talk to you. It's because of you all of this happened.
Why would you do that? Why did you take the Witch's beans?
You stole them and you were caught, and then you did what you do. You just ran away.
If you're looking for forgiveness, you're not going to get it.

Replies.Didascalie: (CONT'D) (pulling the baby close to comfort  HIM)

Replies.Reply: We need to rid this kingdom of the Giant -- together.
She'll be back soon; here's the plan.
We're going to use you as bait to lure the Giant towards the tar pit.
Okay, we don't have much time.
Here's what we're going to do...
Jack, there's something you have to know. Your mother...
No. It wasn't like that. She was fighting with the Giant, trying to protect you, and she was pushed by the Steward -- and -- she fell.
You'll do nothing of the kind.
It's not as easy as that.
Are you okay? Are you alright? We did it! We did it! Come here.
Now we can all return home.
-- of course you can come home with me.
Hey, hey, hey, come on now. Hey, please, come on, come on, it's okay. I know you miss your mother.
WHEN I HAD NO FATHER TO SHOW ME?
blowing the door off its  LEARN WHAT TO BE.
THE KING IS GIVING A FESTIVAL.
I WISH TO GO TO THE FESTIVAL.
The BIRDS begin to make their way out through the fireplace and windows as CINDERELLA sings her incantation.
NOW MAY I GO TO THE FESTIVAL?
Yes. I just need to catch my breath.
Please. Don't let them know I'm here.
Well, what brings you here -- and with a cow?
AND IT MADE A NICE CHANGE.
HE HAS CHARM FOR A PRINCE, I GUESS...
I DON'T MEET A WIDE RANGE.
It's not quite what I expected.
I have no experience with those things.
Don't come any closer to me!
You have attacked me once before.
The tree has fallen. Mother's grave, destroyed.
I shouldn't complain. I'm sure others have suffered worse after the earthquake.
Well, I'm sure the Prince will see to it that the Giant is rid from our land.
Please. Please... Get up! I'm not a princess here.
I had to disguise myself. I'm not permitted to leave the palace unescorted.
Maybe I shouldn't have attended the Ball...
I knew you wouldn't give up.
Oh good friends we need your help more than ever.
That doesn't matter now! What's important is that we find a way to defeat the Giant.
The birds will do their part.
Your father's being very brave. We're going to be very brave too.
The Giant went in that direction.
Maybe I'm not your only love.
I love you. Truly I do.
If you love me, why did you stray?
If this is how you behave as a prince, what kind of king will you be?
Consider that I've been lost. A victim of the Giant.
My father's house was a nightmare.
I'm glad you're here to help me.
Not somebody. A giant who's done a lot of harm.
Oh, be careful, are you alright?
I'll gladly help you with your house.
I WISH MY COW WOULD GIVE US SOME MILK.
I thought if he was nice and warm he might produce some milk.
But Milky-White is my best friend!
Why do I have to go to the next village?
I was heading toward market -- but I seem to have lost my way.
Sell my cow, sir. No less than five pounds.
Beans in exchange for my cow?
Could I buy my cow back someday?
One day, I'll buy you back -- Promise!
But they're magic -- the man said --
Good fortune! Good fortune, sir! Look what I have! Five gold pieces.
A BIG TALL TERRIBLE GIANT AT THE DOOR.
So, here's your money, sir! Five gold pieces. Where is my Milky-White?
But you said I could buy her back. Do you want more money?
You keep that. I'll fetch some more.
Oh, brilliant! My Milky-White. And the owners. And my egg!
And you can have it. Along with the five gold pieces.
You said I could have my cow!
Well, look what I have! A golden egg.
I stole a hen that lays golden eggs from the kingdom of the Giant.
It's true. And you should see the Giant's toy harp. It plays the most beautiful tunes without your even having to touch it.
I am not a liar! I'll get that harp.
But Mother, look. The most beautiful harp.
Milky-White. You're back! I missed you so much!
I'll do it. She'll only milk for me.
Squeeze, pal! You can do it.
You can use the silky hair of the corn--
I'm sorry. I came upon her. She was at the bottom of a cliff...
AND IT ISN'T MINE AT ALL!
BUT I GOT IT FOR MY MOTHER--!
SHE WENT AND DARED ME TO!
YES, IF YOU HADN'T RAISED THEM IN THE  FIRST PLACE--!
Maybe I shouldn't have stolen from the Giant...
If there were just some way we could surprise the Giant.
You needn't worry -- this is easier than a beanstalk.
Wait until my mother hears I've slain the Giant.
Was she killed by the Giant?
The Steward will pay for this.
After we slay the Giant, I will slay him.
What he done was wrong. He should be punished.
What home? I have no one to take care of me.
Now, don't stray and be late!
We've sold our last loaf of bread!
Beans. The Witch's beans! We'll take them with us.
What are you planning to do there?
She must be generous of milk to fetch five pounds?
And if you can't fetch that sum? Then what are you to do?
Beans? We mustn't give up our beans!
Replies.Didascalie: (loudly, for the benefit of the boy)

Replies.Reply: Oh, these are no ordinary beans, son.
They're worth a pound each, at least.
I was just trying to help.
No one would have given him more for this creature. We did him a favor. At least they'll have some food.
Do we want a child or not?
We have one chance. Don't you see that? And if we fail...
If you can't do this for yourself, can't you at least do it for me?
What a beautiful gown you're wearing.
Aren't you the lucky one. Why ever are you in the woods at this hour?
I've never lied to royalty before.
If a prince were looking for me, I certainly wouldn't hide.
Oh, my husband's somewhere in the woods.
Oh, yes. But tell me, the Prince, what was he like?
But why would you run away?
But you will return to the Festival tomorrow eve?
You don't know? What I wouldn't give to be in your shoes.
I see you've got the red cape!
She ran away. I never reached home.
She might just as easily have run from you!
I'm sorry I lost the cow.
Rapunzel, Rapunzel? Let your hair down to me.
I was trying to hold her here for you...
Oh! It's you! And you've the cow!
I pulled it from a maiden in a tower.
And I almost had the fourth, but she got away.
We? You mean you're going to let me stay with you?
A golden egg! I've never seen a golden egg.
Where are the five gold pieces?
You can start by buying a new cow with the money you took from the boy.
You go to the next village, you'll find a cow there.
I'm going to get the slipper.
I have met a maiden with golden slippers these two previous nights.
Yes, I'm sure of it. I'll meet you back here.
Because we have to if we're going to be together...
Please, stop! Just hear me out!
I didn't attack you. I attacked your shoe. I need it. I have a magic bean in exchange for it.
Wait, please. I haven't much time!
I need that shoe to have a child.
Does it make sense that you're running from a prince?
Take my shoes. You'll run faster.
I don't care if this costs me my life...
Please give me the slipper, kind Prince, and all will come to a happy end.
We must search immediately for the maiden who fits this slipper.
And the hair as yellow as corn.
What? You didn't get a real white cow?
And two, the cape was certainly as red as blood.
Please take him for a few moments.
You needn't hold him as if he was so fragile.
I can't take care of him all of the time.
I think it best we get back to the village. We'll take the girl with us.
Look! What have you done to her?
We should fan out. It'll increase our chances.
We'll count our steps from right here.
No. You stay with the baby.
Yes. He's asleep. He'll be safe with the girl.
What if, what if! Five hundred paces.
One eighty-one...one eighty-two... one eighty-three... one eighty-four...
You must be here to slay the Giant.
Yes. Surely you've heard there is a giant in our midst.
Yes, it's a lady giant. Unusual, huh?
I came with my husband. We were ...
No, actually it was my choice.
He goes in for another kiss and she pulls away once more.
Wait one moment, please! We can't do this! You have a Princess!
JUST A TRICK OF THE WOODS.
She looks down to the BAKER'S scarf and pulls it from her waist.
THAT MAKES IT WORTH THE JOURNEYING.
YOU WISH TO GO TO THE FESTIVAL?
WISH TO GO TO THE FESTIVAL?
Cinderella, if you can pick up these lentils, and finish your chores in time, then you may go to the ball with us.
The King is trying to find his son a wife -- not a scullery maid! We must be gone!
It's a perfect fit, Your Highness!
Only a little stunted kitchen wench, which her late father left behind but she cannot present herself. She is too dirty.
How dare you? She wants the boy!
Some people are cut out to battle giants, and others are not. I don't have the constitution. And as long as I can be of no help, I'm going to hide.
Everything will work out fine in the end.
WHAT, YOU WISH TO GO TO THE  WHAT, YOU, CINDERELLA? THE FESTIVAL?
Yes. The steeple tower. We saw him there!
HURRY UP AND DO MY HAIR, CINDERELLA!
HERE, I FOUND A LITTLE TEAR,  CINDERELLA!
CAN'T YOU HIDE IT WITH A HAT?
INTO THE WOODS TO GRANDMOTHER'S  HOUSE...
It's bread for Grandmother so she'll have something good to make her strong.
A quarter of a league further in the woods; her house stands inside a great oak tree.
She continues moving forward, he slithers around her. This WOLF has some smooth moves.
I ate all the sweets and half the loaf of bread.
My Granny made it for me.
I would rather a wolf than you any day.
Oh dear, how uneasy I feel. Perhaps it's all the sweets.
My, Grandmother. You're looking very strange. What big ears you have!
Wait a minute. I never thanked you.
I'm sorry. I should have known better.
AND WE'RE BACK AT THE START.
HOOD, She takes off her cape.
Yes. Maybe Granny will make me another with the skins of the wolf.
Stay away from my cape or I'll slash you into a thousand bits!
My Granny made it for me from a wolf that attacked us. And she gave me this beautiful knife for protection.
Where did you get that egg?
Of course it does. Why don't you go up to the kingdom right now and bring it back and show me?
I'm moving in with Granny. Our whole village collapsed. I couldn't find my mother anywhere. And now I can't find my Granny's cottage.
I went down the dell, and I didn't recognize anything. There was no path.
Where's the stream? Where's the bridge? Where's Granny?
It was you who destroyed our house -
What are we going to do now?
But if we do, she'll kill Jack.
I am very capable of caring for the baby.
WELL, IF SHE HADN'T RAISED  WELL, IF YOU HADN'T THROWN  THEM IN THE FIRST PLACE--!
Maybe I shouldn't have strayed from the path...
But you said we had to find our way out of this together.
It looked like he was going to.
What are we going to do now?
They're in the tree -- over there. We made slings out of my cape.
I think my mother and my Granny would be upset with me.
They said always to make them proud and here I am about to kill somebody.
But a giant's a person. Aren't we to show forgiveness?
And we have nowhere to go, so we'll move in with you.
JACK'S MOTHER Was. She's been dry for weeks. We've no food or money and no choice but to sell her.
ONE KEEPS A COW FOR A FRIEND!
FLORINDA screams, bringing CINDERELLA back to reality.
It's not what I wish. It's what you wish.
Nothing cooking in that belly now, is there? And there will never be...
Unless you do exactly as I say. In three days' time, a Blue Moon will appear. Only then can the curse be undone.
The one I placed on this house!
In the past, when you were no more than a babe, your father brought his young wife and you to this cottage.
No. But you had a sister.

She's mine now and you'll never find her! Small price to pay for what else your father stole from me. It cost me my youth, my beauty. My mother warned me she would punish me with the curse of ugliness if I ever lost them.
Lights suddenly illuminate the BAKER'S FATHER as if it was a flash from the Hiroshima blast. A look of horror crosses his face.
The WIFE falls into the BAKER'S arms, weeping.
And when your mother died, your father deserted you. Your father was no father -- so why should you be?
AND QUEENS: The WITCH grabs some magical looking beans from a SMALL SATCHEL she carries across her body. She displays them.
YOU WISH TO HAVE THE CURSE REVERSED?
I'LL NEED A CERTAIN POTION FIRST.
Why are you standing there?! Go get the cape!
Get it! Get it! Get it!
You go up to the little thing, and you take it.
It's the rules. Why do you think I asked you in the first place? I'm not allowed to touch any of the objects!
Get me what I need! Get me what I need!
Rapunzel. Rapunzel. Let down your hair to me.
Don't you look lovely today, my dear.
I brought your favorite. Blackberries, fresh from the garden.
THE COW IS GONE! GET IT BACK! GET IT  BACK!!!
DON'T COME NEAR ME WITH THAT, FOOL!! I can't touch it! By midnight tomorrow bring me the items or that child you wish for will never see the light of day!
I gave you protection and yet you disobeyed me.
Your prince will never lay eyes on you again. He will never lay eyes on anything again!
It doesn't matter because where you're going, no one will ever see you again.
I see a cow. I see a slipper.
That cow doesn't look as white as milk to me.
This cow has been covered with flour!
Of course I'd prefer a live cow! So show me the dead cow and I'll bring her back to life!
Quiet! Feed the objects to the cow.
You heard me! Feed them to the cow!
Wrong ingredients. Forget about a child!
You what?! What were you doing there?
I touched that hair! I told you! I cannot have touched the ingredients!
Yes! Pull it from the ear and feed it to the cow. Quickly!
We'll get him for you right away.
Would you like a blind girl instead?
I don't know where they think they're going. The giant's already destroyed the entire village. Only thing left of my garden are these beans.
We have no choice. Find the boy and give her what she wants.
And if we don't she'll kill half the kingdom!
Of course you don't recognize me!
This is who I truly am, my dear. Now you don't have to be embarrassed by me. You must come with me. There's a Giant in the land.
Then you leave me no choice.
I was just trying to be a good mother!
Rapunzel, no! You will never be safe with him.
I'll let go of him when I give him to the Giant.
Wake up! When you're dead, you're dead.
Now it's time to get this boy to the Giant before we're all--
This is no time to be soft-hearted!
She lunges for JACK, but LRRH and CINDERELLA put themselves in her path.
WELL, YOU CAN BLAME ANOTHER WITCH.
Now I never said you could. I You would take money before a said you might. child?!
JUST WANT TO GO TO THE KING'S  FESTIVAL...
All THREE of them stop with sudden trepidation.
And what might be in your basket?
And where might your Grandmother live?
With inhuman speed, he manages to suddenly be back in front of the girl on the path.
The WOLF climbs to the top of a precipice where he is silhouetted by the red hot sun. He lets out a mighty howl.
The better to hear you with, my dear.
Racing ahead and then darting out from a tree.
THAT CAN CUT LIKE A KNIFE!
They kiss but their moment of romance is interrupted when a large GOLDEN EGG rolls down the hill between them. The WIFE screams.
Is that you at this hour, my Prince?
I'm no longer a child. I wish to see the world.
What did you do to him?
How could she do this to you?
I will not come with you!
And locked me in a tower.
...and then banished me to an island --
Don't you understand? I never want to see you again. Ever!
Aren't you going to help us skin that beast?
What kind of hunter are you?
If I may, my lord, I think I see her over there.
No sign of her, my liege.
Stop! What is that you have in your hand?
Lying will cost you your life!
Sire! I have succeeded in obtaining the other slipper.
Let it be known that his Royal Highness the Crown Prince will be visiting every house in this village tonight.
All young maidens are hereby commanded to remain in their home until they are visited by the Royal Guard.
Attention! Attention! Let there be no panic. NO PANIC! The Royal Prince wishes to address his loyal subjects.
I have no idea! I don't make policy. I just carry it out.
Don't make her angry, woman, or you'll get us all killed!
The boy is hiding in the steeple tower. You can find him there.
I didn't mean to hurt her. I was just thinking of the greater good.

Characters.Character: YOU ARE EVERYTHING MAIDENS COULD WISH

Replies.Reply: Don't touch us! Get away! How dare you!
Now, I never said I would But you took the five gold sell. pieces.
You took five gold pieces?! I didn't take, you gave.
CINDERELLA hands the WIFE her GOLDEN SLIPPER.
Where is the lad who killed my husband?
And who destroyed my house? I want him!
The boy - I want the boy!
If he is not, I will return tonight and find you! All of you!
You never have to be afraid. Now come with me.
They're interrupted by the ominous sounds of the approaching  GIANT.
The BAKER hears his WIFE'S voice. We see her over his shoulder.
